classification.reason: Valid SystemVerilog syntax (confirmed by slang and verilator) causes assertion failure in CIRCT. The test case uses string type as module output port which is legal per IEEE 1800-2017 but triggers a crash in MooreToCore conversion.

feature_support.notes: string is a valid SystemVerilog data type but is simulation-only. CIRCT should either support it or emit a proper error, not crash.

results.message: Port with type string is not supported (tool limitation, not syntax error)

ieee_compliance.notes: string is a built-in data type in SystemVerilog. While it is a simulation-only type and not synthesizable, it is valid syntax.

recommendation: Report as bug. CIRCT should handle string port types gracefully - either by supporting simulation constructs or by emitting a proper error message instead of crashing.
